title: Duquesne 53, Alderson Broaddus 18
text: Written by Ben Eshenbaugh Created on October 10, 2015 @ 9:31PM Courtesy gobattlers.com: PITTSBURGH -- The Alderson Broaddus football team dropped a 53-18 decision to host Duquesne Saturday afternoon. Darius Frederick had a big day for the Battlers hauling in four catches for 113 yards and a touchdown. Wilson Vaughn threw for 246 and a score while Brandon Jones picked up 77 yards on 18 carries. The Battlers took the first possession and moved the ball 53-yards on nine plays and got on the board first with Jordan Butler 40-yard field goal to go-up 3-0. The Dukes answered with a 65-yard strike from Dillon Buelchel to Wayne Capers to go up 7-3 with 10:33 to play. AB forced a Duquesne turnover and turned it into three points on an 18-yard field goal from Butler to trim the lead to 7-6 at the 4:51 mark of the first half. The Dukes extended the lead with a Buchel to Chris King touchdown combo at the 14:57 mark of the second quarter. Buchel and King would hook up again midway through the second to push the advantage to 20-6. The Dukes kicked a field goal at the end of the half to take a 23-6 edge into the break. Duquesne scored on the opening possession of the second half on a Rafiq Douglas 21 yard touchdown catch. King hauled in his third TD catch of the game to push the lead to 36-6. After a Duke touchdown that extended the lead to 43-6 with 32 second left in the third, the AB offense connected on a big play with Wilson Vaughn finding Frederick for a 48-yard score to get within 43-12. The Dukes added a field goal with 2:23 to play and Marcus Anderson took the ensuing kick-off 100 yards for the Battlers. On the Battler kick Nahari Crawford went 100 yards to set the final. The Battlers are now 5-1 overall and return to action on a short week to host Glenville State Thursday night at 7 p.m. in the program's first home night game. Share
